div.head: Summary
div.p: The United States recognized the Kingdom of Transjordan as an independent state in a White House announcement on January 31, 1949.

div.head: U.S. Recognition of Jordanian Independence, 1949.
div.p: The United States recognized the Kingdom of Transjordan as an independent state in a White House announcement on January 31, 1949. Transjordan had been a mandated territory placed under the protection of Great Britain following World War I, and had declared its independence with the agreement of Great Britain on May 25, 1946.

div.head: Establishment of Diplomatic Relations and the American Legation in Jordan, 1949.
div.p: Diplomatic relations and the American Legation in Jordan were established on February 18, 1949 when Wells Stabler presented his credentials as Chargé d’Affaires ad interim at Amman.
